meanings.definition: To emphasize or make more noticeable.
meanings.sent1: She was accentuating her outfit with a bright scarf.
meanings.sent2: The artist was accentuating the colors in his painting.
meanings.sent3: The clown was accentuating his big shoes with tiny bells.
meanings.sent4: The sunlight accentuating the beauty of the garden.

meanings.definition: To highlight or bring attention to.
meanings.sent1: He was accentuating the key points in his presentation.
meanings.sent2: The teacher was accentuating the importance of reading.
meanings.sent3: The detective was accentuating the suspicious behavior of the suspect.
meanings.sent4: The spotlight accentuating the lead singer on stage.
meanings.sent5: The sign accentuating the entrance to the park.

meanings.definition: To intensify or make more prominent.
meanings.sent1: The spices were accentuating the flavors of the dish.
meanings.sent2: The music was accentuating the mood of the scene.
meanings.sent3: The magician was accentuating the magic trick with a dramatic gesture.
meanings.sent4: The storm accentuating the power of nature.
meanings.sent5: The candlelight accentuating the romance of the evening.
